item.title: Yemen's Saudi-backed govt launches operation against UAE-backed separatists
item.description: Yemen's Saudi-backed government launched what it called a peaceful operation to take back military positions from the UAE-backed southern separatists on Friday, who in turn said seven Saudi airstrikes had taken place since the declaration. The Saudi-backed governor of Yemen's Hadramout province an

item.title: Leaders of 1990’s All-Party Student Alliance offer fateha at Khaleda Zia’s grave
item.description: The leaders of 1990's DUCSU and All-Party Student Alliance on Friday paid tributes to the grave of former prime minister and BNP chairperson Begum Khaleda Zia. After paying tributes, the then vice-president (VP) of Dhaka University Central Students Union (DUCSU) and the convener of the All-Party S

item.title: Inqilab Moncho sets 22-working-day deadline for trial in Hadi killing
item.description:
Inqilab Moncho has announced plans to launch a movement to oust the government if the trial over the killing of Sharif Osman bin Hadi is not completed within 22 working days.
The organisation’s Member Secretary Abdullah Al Jaber made the announcement on Friday after

item.title: Shoe trader found murdered at Savar home
item.description: A businessman was murdered by miscreants at his residence in Savar, police said on Friday. The victim was identified as Delwar Hossain, a shoe trader by profession. His body was recovered this evening from his house in Baradeshi Uttarpara area under Aminbazar Union of Savar. According to

item.title: Policewoman ‘takes own life’ in Dhaka
item.description: A policewoman has hanged herself in apparent suicide in Dhaka’s Dakhshinkhan, police say citing her family. The 28-year-old Rajia Sultana Mim, a Nayek at the Armed Police Battalion (APBn), was a native of Barishal’s Wazirpur. Police said Rajia hanged herself from the grill on the balc

item.title: Earthquake of magnitude 6.3 strikes southern Mexico
item.description: A magnitude 6.3 earthquake struck the southern Mexican state of Guerrero on Friday, the German Research Center for Geosciences (GFZ) said. The quake was at a depth of 10 km (6.21 miles), GFZ said. There was no serious damage in Guerrero reported immediately, Mexico’s President Claudia Shein

item.title: Rumeen rues independent run
item.description: Rumeen Farhana, a recently expelled leader of the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP), has filed her nomination for the Brahmanbaria-2 constituency as an independent candidate, expressing a sense of irony about her political fate. During the scrutiny of nomination papers at the Brahmanbaria deputy

item.title: Zelenskiy names spy chief to head presidential administration in big shake-up
item.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy named Ukraine’s defence spy chief as his top adviser on Friday, placing a popular military leader at the centre of decision-making as Kyiv seeks to strengthen its defences against Russia and its hand in U.S.-backed peace talks. The appointment of Kyrylo Budanov,

item.title: US imposes 1pc tax on cash and money order remittances
item.description: The United Stated has introduced a one per cent tax on money migrants send home to their families in other countries, including Bangladesh. The new tax took effect from Thursday, the first day of the year. The tax applies to remittances sent via cash, money order, or any other “cashier&rsqu

item.title: CPB leader Kafi’s nomination scratched in Cumilla-5 seat
item.description: The nomination of Abdullah Al Kafi, general secretary of the Communist Party of Bangladesh (CPB), has been declared invalid after scrutiny. Kafi had collected and submitted his nomination papers as the CPB’s candidate for the Cumilla-5 (Burichang-Brahmanpara) constituency. Cumilla Returning

item.title: Fire at Kushtia’s cosmetics warehouse causes Tk 40 lakhs loss
item.description: A fire broke out on Friday at a cosmetics warehouse in Taha Market, Borobazar, Kushtia, causing an estimated loss of around Tk 40 lakhs. The blaze started around noon at the warehouse of New Sadia Traders, which stored cosmetics, toys, and other items. A unit of the Kushtia Fire Service quickly ar

item.title: 2 nominations suspended, 2 cancelled in Barishal
item.description: In the verification process for parliamentary constituencies 4, 5, and 6, the Returning Officer has suspended two nominations and cancelled two others in Barishal.
